result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
to be signed and posted at Clerk of Courts office by 4pm tomorrow (10/26/22) or bench warrant
Standard Conditions
Additional Conditions:
No contact directly or indirectly with the party/parties named in the bail bond, no contact at their residence/property - 5 block radius.
Not possess any dangerous weapons.   
Not to consume alcoholic beverages, illegal drugs or possess drug paraphernalia. 
Not to be on the premises of any tavern or business whose sole purpose is the sale of alcoholic beverages. 
Not possess controlled substances except for those medications specifically prescribed for him/her by a health care professional. 
Not to possess needles/syringes except with a valid prescription. 
Remain in the County of Sheboygan except every other weekend for visitation with her children in Michigan.
Comply with day reporting requirements - GPS

5:14 PM Defendant Kyra Marie Niemi appeared by phone.  Attorney William Andrew Mayer appeared by phone for Kyra Marie Niemi.  Attorney Joel N Urmanski in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Court notes that most recent bond allowing Deft to go to Michigan is unsigned and therefore previous bond would be reverted back to. 
State agrees.
Court notes Day Report stating Deft has visited multiple different Counties, numerous violations over several days.
Atty Mayer states Deft has been traveling to different places due to harassment from an ex.
State notes incorrect address in CCAP, still listed as Jail and Deft is no longer in custody. State requesting bond to be increased by $1000.00 to a total of $1500.00 and all other conditions to remain.
Defense requesting minimal increase of no more than $150.00.
Court orders $500.00 cash bond on deposit forfeited and set new $1000.00 cash bond and to come in by 4pm tomorrow at the Clerk of Courts Office to sign and post new bond or bench warrant to be issued.
Same conditions as previous unsigned cash bond.
Bail/bond hearing on October 25, 2022 at 04:30 pm.

Defendant to notify Day Reporting w/anticipated travel dates and address in Michigan.
